attributes.title: Stock verification
attributes.description:
Findings;

·       A stock take exercise was conducted on 12.05.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets.

·       The following were the stock findings;

Ø  Bread variance- (+7 loaves)

Ø  Polybags-  (-343 pieces)

Summary of the findings
attributes.effect: •    Minimal variances noted is an indication that stock controls are being observed.

value: •    A cumulative shortfall -13.5 loaves and polybags variance of +274 pieces was reported in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Bread weight check
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

·        All sample varieties had minimal cases of underweight.

·        The underweight samples were spread as follows; 200g W- 12%, 400g W- 08% and 800g W- 11%.

The table below summarizes the findings
attributes.recommendation: Weight controls should be maintained.
attributes.effect: •    Minimal cases of underweight is an indication that production standards are being observed.

value: •    Cases of underweight reported in the previous audit were as follows; 200g W- 01%, 400g W-05% and 800g W-0%.

attributes.title: Damages Analysis
attributes.description:
·        Analysis of bread damages from 10.04.25 – 11.05.25 was done to verify if the level of bread damages was maintained within the set limits of 0.25% of the total production and 0.2% of the total sales.

·        A total of 1,350.5 loaves were damaged under production damages which represent 0.22% of the total loaves produced.

·        1,403 loaves were damaged under market damages representing 0.19% of the total sales over the audited period.

·        Both production and market damages were maintained within the set limits.

Below is a summary table of the findings
attributes.recommendation: •    The effective controls should be maintained.
attributes.effect: •    Damages are maintained within the set limit indicating that controls on damages are effective and do not expose the company to losses.

value: •    Both market and production damages were maintained within the set limit as per the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Cash Verification
attributes.description:
Findings;
•    A spot check was done on cash office to verify if the branch petty cash was well maintained.
•    No material variances were noted on the spot-check day.
attributes.recommendation: •    The branch should ensure that patty cash records and balances are well maintained
attributes.effect: •    The immaterial variance noted in cash office is an indication that   effective controls are in place.

value: •    No variances were reported in the cash office in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Minishop spot-checks
attributes.description:
•    Spot checks was done on the branch minishops to find out if they were run as per the company policy.
•    On the spot-check days, no issue of non-compliance was noted in the visited minishops.
attributes.recommendation: •    Minishops SOPs to continue being observed.

value: •    SOPs were observed in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Production and packaging efficiency were analyzed from 10.04.25 – 11.05.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiencies.

·        The branch hired a total of 695 production workers over the audited period hence the expected production was 3,128 bags.

·        The actual production was 3,124 bags leading to an actual efficiency of 4.5 bags per worker which is within the range

·        The set efficiency was achieved

Production efficiency
attributes.recommendation: •    Management to improve on the planning of production workers to ensure that the set efficiencies are consistently achieved
attributes.effect: •    Production efficiency was achieved indicating that labour cost incurred was within the forecasted range.

attributes.title: Packaging Efficiency
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Production and packaging efficiency were analyzed from 10.04.25 – 11.05.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiency of 97 crates per worker.

·        The total converted bread produced over the audited period is 41,505 crates hence the expected slicers to be recruited was 428 workers.

·        A total of 436 workers were hired leading to a packaging efficiency of 95.2 crates per worker which is below the limit.

·        Extra eight workers were hired.

Packaging efficiency
attributes.recommendation: The management to improve on the planning of packaging workers to ensure that the set efficiency is consistently achieved.
attributes.effect: •    The extra workers recruited is an indication that actual packaging cost exceeded the budget by Ksh. 7,296.

value: •    Packaging efficiency reported in the previous audit report was 97.3 crates per worker.

attributes.title: Delivery vehicle fuel usage analysis
attributes.description:
Findings;
•    Analysis of fuel consumption by the delivery vehicles was done for the month of April 2025 to verify if their consumption rate is within the set standards.
•    Comparison between the actual fuel used and standard fuel set was done for the 3 motor vehicles assigned to the branch KDG 426W, KCD 152A and KCL 046A.
•    No material variance between the actual fuel usage and the set standards.
attributes.recommendation: •    The set controls on fuel usage should be strictly adhered.
attributes.effect: Fuel consumption rates are within the range indicating that fuel controls are being observed.

attributes.title: Generator fuel usage
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Review of generator fuel usage and machine hours records was done to ascertain that its use is as per the set policies.

·        The generator had run for 5.4 hours and used 120 litres of diesel fuel over the period from 1 April to 30th April 2025.

·        The average rate of fuel consumption was 22.2 L/Hr which is within the range.

Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: Proper controls should be maintained.
attributes.effect: •    Fuel usage is within the limit indicating that proper generator controls are in place.

value: •    The average fuel consumption rate reported in the previous audit findings was 24.3 L/Hr.
